intro: Physospermopsis obtusiuscula, commonly known as the blunt-fruited physosperm, is a rare and unusual plant belonging to the family Physospermaceae. It is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and unique, capsule-like fruits that remain attached to the plant for an extended period. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, often in temperate regions with cool climates. Its flowers are inconspicuous, with a simple structure that facilitates wind pollination. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
